Hi everyone

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: How will you deal with AC here? Is it full plate, or do you rather want the monk attack progression with the Kamas?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: Is there a particular reason why you chose BG other than to avoid the multiclass penalty as an elf? Currently the only thing BG adds is 3d6 sneak attack and stackable Bull's Strength since you don't invest in CHA or Taunt. Something like a Monk9/Ass21/Figh10 would have enough feats for DC: Kama on top of your current build, although avoiding the multiclass penalty would involve juggling the monk and fighter levels. Going human would open up even more options while avoiding the multiclass penalty but that would require dropping Keen Senses.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Mick and Yunim for your comments!

RE AC I was planning for robes & UMD to supplement with the Monk UBAB and Monk Speed, but light and medium armor are options. I wouldn't use Heavy armor wouldn't make sense with such a large investment in stealth and having a base dex of 16. AC can be increased with both dex and wis buffs with robes on, although the Wis 8 score means that at least +4 wis would be needed to increase the AC

I like your suggestion to choose fighter Yunim rather than Blackguard, it grants 6 bonus feats and allows me to dump Charisma. I like the level split you suggested too. Dodging the multiclass exp penalty should be achievable. I'll have a look at reworking the build when I get some time.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
AC is gonna be nasty bad!

Which means you will run into trouble around mid Epics (on WoG, anyways).  You will need some MAJOR socket items to fill in the holes here!  It's doable, but will probably take a few years of game time to actually get everything you need.

I would say get some of the light armor on WoG - there is a set that is perfect for this build (this will "nerf" your Monk UBAB and Wis, unfortunately).  That will pretty much take care of the Dex.  You will need some Str, I am thinking, along with DR and Regen.

Still going to be some low AC, especially on the other side of level 30!

Let me know how it turns out.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
It's a hard choice, really.

I've tried ALOT of different combinations of this  on WoG - with Monk/Ftr/WM.  It just is like juggling too many variables!  I can get AB up...and lose AC.  AC up, and lose AB.

Just too much to try to squeeze in.

It's like...just missing 1 level!  Or 1 extra Class!  It's like almost being able to lick the ice cream through bars!

Even when I could get everything to "work" - no Uncanny Dodge to cement the AC Dex bonus.  It is what caused me to go a totally diffrerent route for WoG - 38 Monk/2 Ass.

That is really wiping things out.

But a totally different build as here.  Though I think if you would stop for a moment, and think about "what are you really trying to accomplish with this build?" you might see my point.

And keep exploring and learning new things of course, there are so many ways builds can go, in many ways the unfinished builds section is very much me doing this, looking for ways to make something special, which does occur occasionally, but for sure, if I have 80% bad ideas 20% good ideas I'll take that any day :)

If AC is a problem going strength monk then I'll can go dexterity based which works well with Assassin

I have read improved sneak attack is bugged if assassin is taken without either rogue or blackguard levels so the bonus feats go into dexterity, for extra AB and AC

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
This starts to look like how I build my Assassins. Great dexterity as a bonus feat can give you a warrior like AB and very good AC. You don't get that bonus feat from rogue. A high number of Assassin levels gives a high DC, several epic bonus feats for Great dexterity and enough Death attack damage,

If you want Epic dodge, you can go Monk 9/ SD 5 since you already are into Monk. Another option is Rogue 13. Monk 9/ Rogue 10 eats up too many Assassin levels IMO.  Rogue gives SA damage but the DA DC suffers.
